recent_signals.headline: Staffing company stocks in freefall: RHI -51%, MAN -39%, KELYA -20% - professional labor demand structurally collapsing
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Market-priced confirmation of professional labor substitution via AI. Gradient (professional > industrial) isolates AI effect from cyclical recession.

recent_signals.headline: P3 Cost Collapse Index at maximum (100.0) - productivity surging while unit labor costs declining
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Widest gap between AI capability costs and human labor costs ever measured. Maximum economic pressure for AI substitution.

recent_signals.headline: Klarna reversal: AI-only customer support failed, now rehiring humans - P7 timing arbitrage confirmed
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Precedent failure confirms AI-only doesn't work for complex/emotional support. Hybrid human+AI required. Timing arbitrage vacuum opening.

recent_signals.headline: COUNTER: Customer support tool layer saturated - Intercom, Zendesk, Freshdesk, Kustomer all AI-enabled
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Counter-signal challenging Customer Support thesis. Tool layer saturated. CRITICAL UNKNOWN: Is service layer also saturated?

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 425120 Wholesale Trade Agents/Brokers: 512K employees, 122K firms, LOW competitive density - pure matchmaking intermediaries
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Pure intermediaries with zero inventory, 100% coordination value. Coasean collapse candidate. LOW competitive density (needs verification).

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 541611 Management Consulting: 837K employees, 166K firms, MEDIUM density - boutique disruption opportunity
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Small operational consulting boutiques squeezed by marketplaces below, AI-augmented large firms above. Tool layer crowded, service layer unknown.

recent_signals.headline: Capital Environment Index at maximum (100.0) - rates falling, credit easing, stress at minimum
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Capital cheap and abundant. Combined with P3=100, creates most favorable macro setup for AI-native business formation ever measured.

recent_signals.headline: Beveridge Curve r=-0.658 - structural mismatch, not cyclical recession
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Openings falling while unemployment rising = matching function broken. Structural labor market mismatch confirms AI changing skill requirements faster than workforce adapts.

recent_signals.headline: NAICS 621210 Dental Offices: 130K+ practices, LOW competitive density in admin AI, Archy pioneer at $47M
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Diagnostics AI crowded, practice operations sparse. Demographic pressure building. Regulatory complexity (DSO) and Mars consolidation threat.

recent_signals.headline: Creative Destruction Index at 0.0 - new business formation stalling despite maximum favorable conditions
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Business applications down 69.7% YoY despite P3=100, Capital=100. Low entrepreneurial activity = sparse competition. FAVORABLE signal.

opportunity_clusters.name: Customer Support Vacuum Filler — Managed Hybrid Human+AI
opportunity_clusters.thesis: Companies prematurely cutting human support before AI can deliver. Pure AI fails (Klarna reversal, CNET, SI, Air Canada, NEDA). Tool layer saturated but SERVICE layer may be sparse. Staffing canary (-51%) confirms structural demand collapse.
opportunity_clusters.vc_hook: We fill the timing arbitrage vacuum between premature human cuts and AI that can't deliver — managed hybrid support at 40-60% cost of pure human, 10x reliability of pure AI. Market-priced validation: professional staffing -51%.
opportunity_clusters.next_action: PRIORITY 1: Competitive density deep-dive on managed hybrid customer support SERVICE layer

opportunity_clusters.name: Veterinary Services — Agentic Practice Operations
opportunity_clusters.thesis: Proven sparse competitive density ($200-400M). Demographic gap widening. COUNTER: Mars consolidation accelerating (high threat).
opportunity_clusters.vc_hook: The only sector that passed the competitive density filter (sparse $200-400M vs $3-5B+ everywhere else). We're the practice operating system for independent vets before Mars consolidates them.
opportunity_clusters.next_action: OVERDUE: Mars/IDEXX threat assessment, practice acquisition economics

opportunity_clusters.name: Wholesale Trade AI Broker — NAICS 425120
opportunity_clusters.thesis: Pure intermediaries (512K emp, 122K firms, 4.2 avg/firm) with zero inventory = 100% coordination value. Dead business revival: B2B marketplaces failed in dot-com but AI 100x cheaper now. LOW competitive density estimate.
opportunity_clusters.vc_hook: The dot-com B2B marketplace thesis was right but too early — coordination costs are now 100x lower. We target fragmented wholesale trade where agents add zero operational value, only matching.
key_data: Dead revival: Chemdex/Covisint failed, AI 100x cheaper
opportunity_clusters.next_action: Deep competitive scan, segment analysis for lowest incumbent moats

opportunity_clusters.name: LATAM Nearshoring + AI Augmentation
opportunity_clusters.thesis: LATAM professionals at 30-50% US cost + AI tools = hybrid service delivery. COUNTER: Traditional BPO giants (Globant $2B, TTEC $2.1B) already operate LATAM at scale. Differentiation: AI-augmented professional services (not call center BPO).
opportunity_clusters.vc_hook: Traditional BPO is call centers. We're AI-augmented professional services — accounting, legal research, customer success ops — delivered by LATAM professionals with AI at 40-60% US cost.
opportunity_clusters.next_action: Distinguish AI-augmented LATAM professional services from traditional BPO, identify vertical with highest arbitrage

opportunity_clusters.name: Boutique Management Consulting Replacement — NAICS 541611
opportunity_clusters.thesis: Small boutiques (837K emp, 166K firms, 5.0 avg/firm) squeezed by Upwork below, Accenture AI above. NAICS 541611 excludes MBB. Tool layer crowded, service replacement sparse. Staffing canary confirms collapse.
opportunity_clusters.vc_hook: Small consulting boutiques are the 'middle class' of professional services — too expensive vs marketplaces, too small vs AI-augmented large firms. We replace the boutique entirely with AI + offshore hybrid at 30-40% cost.
key_data: Squeezed by Upwork below, Accenture above
opportunity_clusters.next_action: Competitive scan of AI consulting service operators, segment analysis

opportunity_clusters.name: Dental Practice Operations AI — NAICS 621210
opportunity_clusters.thesis: 130K+ practices, admin burden rising. Diagnostics crowded, operations sparse. Archy $47M pioneer. COUNTER: 38 states restrict ownership (DSO workaround), Mars consolidation.
opportunity_clusters.vc_hook: Dental AI funding went to diagnostics. Practice operations — the actual pain point — remains sparse. We're the 'practice in a box' software. DSO-compliant model.
opportunity_clusters.next_action: Verify competitive landscape in practice operations, research DSO economics, assess Mars/IDEXX threat

cross_signal_patterns.pattern: Composite Index Convergence at Maximum — P3 Cost Collapse (100.0) and Capital Environment (100.0) both at maximum. Most favorable macro setup ever measured. BUT creates competitive density risk.

Market-Priced Professional Labor Collapse — Staffing stocks (RHI -51%, MAN -39%, KELYA -20%) confirm structural labor substitution 6-12 months before government data. Engine's first MARKET-PRICED external validation.
Timing Arbitrage Vacuum — Multiple precedent failures (Klarna, CNET, SI, Air Canada, NEDA) confirm AI-only fails for complex/emotional tasks. Hybrid models required. Window = 12-24 months.
Tool vs Service Layer Distinction — Across multiple sectors, TOOL layer saturated but SERVICE layer density UNKNOWN. This distinction is make-or-break filter for new pipeline candidates.
Creative Destruction Stalling Despite Maximum Conditions — Business apps down 69.7% despite P3=100, Capital=100. Low entrepreneurial activity = sparse competition. FAVORABLE signal.
Profits-Wages Divergence — Corporate profits +7% while wages +1.6%, r=-0.347. Productivity gains flowing to profits, not wages. Margin capture accelerates substitution pressure.

No Liquidation Pressure Despite Labor Substitution — P2 at 0.0 despite staffing -51%. Incumbents adapting successfully. REDUCES distressed acquisition appeal, INCREASES urgency of AI-native competition.
